cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north–northwest, forecast to reach the North Carolina coast Friday night/early Saturday, then track inland across the Mid-Atlantic toward the lower Chesapeake Bay and off the New Jersey coast by late Sunday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to southern North Carolina coast (between Cape Fear and Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Chincoteague VA and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from South Carolina through New Jersey, including the Chesapeake Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely outcome is breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 mph Saturday into early Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible in upper Chesapeake Bay; surge heights generally below 2 ft near Baltimore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Friday night through Saturday, producing localized urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along nearby Atlantic beaches; elevated river levels could briefly restrict vessel drafts on tidal portions of the Patapsco River.
